BR_text.BRsummary: Default `localhost` does not seem to bind properly in some settings / "ERROR - empty resource"
BR_text.BRdescription:
Typically, starting dede defaults on localhost:8080 and in some cases querying localhost from API returns nothing. Switching to 127.0.0.1 clears the problem.
 This issue in case it is a possibility that the binding issue comes from deepdetect embedded web server (based on boost).

comments_0.comment_text: I am facing the same issue.

comments_1.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/codeAshu>@codeAshu</denchmark-link>
  start server with:
 <denchmark-code>./dede -host 127.0.0.1
 </denchmark-code>
 
 Still not sure where the problem comes from.

comments_2.comment_text:
Some progress... this is due to ipv6 binding on localhost. Typically, commenting out:
 <denchmark-code>::1 localhost
 </denchmark-code>
 
 in /etc/hosts fixes the issue.
 Still looking for better fix.

comments_3.comment_text:
More analysis reveals that this is very likely to be related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cpp-netlib/cpp-netlib/pull/448>cpp-netlib/cpp-netlib#448</denchmark-link>
  and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cpp-netlib/cpp-netlib/issues/447>cpp-netlib/cpp-netlib#447</denchmark-link>
  for versions of cpp-netlib prior to 0.11.1. Ubuntu 14.04, which is the supported platform for dd, appears to ship with 0.11.0. In the meantime I'll commit a quick fix internal to dd that clears the issue for  binding to  as .
